text: Cornel Țălnar (born 9 June 1957) is a Romanian football manager and former player. ==Playing career== Țălnar was born in Bărăbanţ, Alba County and began playing for Dinamo Bucharest in the country's first division (Divizia A) in 1977. Țălnar was capped 6 times in the Romanian national football team between 1979 and 1981. ==Coaching career== After he retired, Țălnar was the head coach, in Liga I, of Inter Sibiu (1995–1996), Dinamo București (1996–1997, 2007–2008), Universitatea Cluj-Napoca (1997–1998), FC Braşov (1998–1999) and Ceahlăul Piatra Neamţ (2000–2001). After Walter Zenga resigned from Dinamo București in the autumn of 2007 he was appointed as interim coach. He was again appointed as interim coach of Dinamo Bucharest after Gheorghe Mulţescu resigned in the beginning of 2008. He was again appointed as interim coach of Dinamo București after Marin Ion resigned in October 2009 and led the team until June 2010 when he was replaced by Ioan Andone. In December 2012 he replaced Dorinel Munteanu as head coach of Dinamo Bucharest, starting his fifth spell at the helm of the club. He was sacked at the end of the season after he failed to qualify the team for a European competition. ==Trivia== His nephew, Gheorghe Grozav is also a footballer. ==Honours== ===Player=== ;Dinamo București * Romanian League: 1981–82, 1982–83, 1983–84 * Romanian Cup: 1981–82, 1983–84 ===Coach=== ;FC Brașov * Romanian Second League: 1998–99 ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1957 births Category:Sportspeople from Alba Iulia Category:Living people Category:Romanian footballers Category:Romania international footballers Category:FC Unirea Alba Iulia players Category:FC Dinamo București players Category:SR Brașov players Category:FC Petrolul Ploiești players Category:Liga I players Category:Liga II players Category:Romanian football managers Category:FC Dinamo București managers Category:FC Universitatea Cluj managers Category:CSM Ceahlăul Piatra Neamț managers Category:SR Brașov managers Category:CS Concordia Chiajna managers Category:CS Luceafărul Oradea managers Category:Association football wingers
title: Cornel Țălnar
